cluster_relations.rel_desc: Graphitization alters the microstructure of carbon steels after long-term operation, degrading their mechanical properties.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: operation in the 800°F to 1100°F (427°C to 593°C) range
qualifiers.CausalHint: that may cause a loss in strength, ductility, and/or creep resistance

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Graphitization alters the microstructure of 0.5Mo steels during long-term high-temperature operation.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: operation in the 800°F to 1100°F (427°C to 593°C) range
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: DamageType: loss in strength, ductility, and/or creep resistance

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Graphitization corresponds to decomposition of carbide phases into graphite nodules, effectively producing graphite nodules in the steel.
remarks: Carbide phases are not an explicit entity; relation framed between graphitization and graphite nodules to preserve transformation context.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A process or condition changes or modifies the microstructure of a material, potentially affecting its properties.
args.justification: Both relations describe graphitization changing the microstructure of steels under long-term high-temperature operation. The existing relation_name is already a good reusable predicate, so it is adopted as the canonical_rel_name. These are structural-change relations, so rel_cls is set to 'structure_relation' and grouped under 'MODIFICATION' to reflect microstructural modification.

args.canonical_rel_desc: A process or agent generates or results in the formation of a product, phase, or feature.
args.justification: This relation states that graphitization leads to the formation of graphite nodules, i.e., a transformation where the process produces a microstructural product. The relation_name 'produces' is appropriate as the canonical predicate. It is classified as a transformation_relation and placed under the broad causal group, since the process causally produces the product.
args.remark: Although the underlying metallurgical detail involves carbide decomposition, the modeled relation between graphitization and graphite nodules is correctly captured as a production/formation relation.
